channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-13793] HTTPSolrCall makes cascading calls even when all replicas are down for a collection
item.description:
REMOTEQUERY action in HTTPSolrCall ends up making too many cascading remoteQuery calls when all all the replicas of a collection are in down state.
This results in increase in thread count, unresponsive solr nodes and eventually node (one's which have this collection) going out of live nodes.

Example scenario: Consider a cluster with 3 nodes(solr1, solrw1, solr-overseer1). A collection is present on solr1, solrw1 but both replicas are in down state. When a search request is made to solr-overseer1, since replica is not present locally a remote query is made to solr1 (we also consider inactive slices/coreUrls), solr1 also doesn't see an active replica present locally, it forwards to solrw1, again solrw1 will forward request to solr1. This goes on till both of solr1, solrw1 become unresponsive. Attached logs for this.

This is happening because we are considering inactive slices, inactive coreUrl while forwarding requests to nodes.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Bring down all replicas of a collection but ensure nodes containing them are up
  2. Make any search call to any of solr nodes for this collection.

Possible fixes:

  1. Ensure we select only active slices/coreUrls before making remote queries
  2. Put a limit on cascading calls probably limit to number of replicas

item.summary: HTTPSolrCall makes cascading calls even when all replicas are down for a collection

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
As per https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SOLR-4553 we are attempting to proxy requests more aggressively , this leads to scenarios mentioned in this bug.

markrmiller@gmail.com Can we improve accuracy in getting active slices / coreUrls itself. or else we can put a limit on cascading remote queries when considering dead replicas/slices

I have added a PR following approach 2 mentioned in description, where i have considered limiting number of cascading remote query calls to number of shards * replication factor in cases when there is no active replica for a collection.

ichattopadhyayamarkrmiller@gmail.com munendrasn Please review and suggest changes if any. I will be adding test cases for the same

THanks for your report and the fix. There's a patch and a Github PR both. Please keep only one of them here.
I'll perhaps have some time to review it tomorrow. Meanwhile, if you have some time, munendrasn, can you please review?
I shall review this tonight. I think we should include this in 8.3.
Sounds good, let me know if you need any changes or separate patch.

Commit 71f32a293159fbff4118c51467a8277d138e80b6 in lucene-solr's branch refs/heads/jira/SOLR-13793 from Ishan Chattopadhyaya
[ https://gitbox.apache.org/repos/asf?p=lucene-solr.git;h=71f32a2 ]

SOLR-13793: Limiting number of forwards to total replicas in collection to avoid deadly forwarding loops

keshareenv, I've updated your patch with the following:

  1. Instead of (shards * replicationFactor), I've chosen the limit as the number of total replicas in a collection (across all shards).
  2. Renamed the test to call it "down collection" instead of "infected collection".
    Please take a look at the branch above and review the same.

Haven't opened a fresh PR for it (should I have? I'm still getting used to the Github based, i.e. non-patch based, workflow).
Here's the commit I'm talking about: https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/commit/71f32a293159fbff4118c51467a8277d138e80b6

As a proper fix, later on (in another ticket), I think if a node receives a request but has a down core, then it should do a live fetch of the cluster state and forward only to a node having an active core (or else fail fast).

changes LGTM as defence mechanism without which request would go into an infinite loop which eventually brings down the node(unresponsive node). 

If I'm not wrong, solr. prefix is added parameter name to avoid conflicts with user's query parameters. If so, could we please rename the parameter so that it starts and ends with _. This is similar to field names where any fieldnames starting and ending with _ are stated as reserved. We could follow similar convention here too and we won't require the prefix

  • How would this work with authentication enabled? AFIK, authentication is done at the nodes which has replica (but not sure about this). Just to be sure, could we please add a test with authentication enabled?
  • Based on code flow, this fix should also work for v2 API as extractRemotePath is called in both cases. could we please add test for this too?

ichattopadhyaya Commit look good, I was trying to avoid iterating through slices by getting replication factor while getting slices.

munendrasn Fix should work for v2 solr client as well as you have mentioned. Since authentication is done in same request as query execution, those requests should not behave any differently. i.e they will also go through HttpSolrCall remote query execution flow.

Thanks for suggestions! I shall update test cases with the same.

ichattopadhyaya I have improved test cases based on munendrasn's review. Please cherry-pick changes from https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/pull/922/commits/1b01536771ffcf1fdd1769a1381549e4b571a214
